trans-unit.source: Converts a scroll bar visibility and scroll position to <xref href="System.Windows.Visibility"></xref> values.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Primitives.RibbonTabHeadersPanel> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Primitives.RibbonTabsPanel> provide horizontal scrolling behavior for the ribbon.
When scrolling is needed, the ribbon replaces the typical scroll bar with a repeat button at each end of the ribbon.
This converter uses the visibility and position of the scroll bar to determine the visibility of each of the repeat buttons.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Primitives.RibbonScrollButtonVisibilityConverter"></xref> class.
Converts a scroll bar visibility and scroll position to a <xref href="System.Windows.Visibility"></xref> value.

The three <xref:System.Double> values that represent the scroll bar position are the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Primitives.RibbonTabsPanel.HorizontalOffset%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Primitives.RibbonTabsPanel.ExtentWidth%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Primitives.RibbonTabsPanel.ViewportWidth%2A> property values of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Primitives.RibbonTabsPanel> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Primitives.RibbonTabHeadersPanel>.
These properties contain values from the panelâ€™s internal <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer>.
The `parameter` value represents the desired percentage that the ribbon is scrolled to the right before the scroll button is hidden.
By default, the left scroll button passes 0 as the parameter, and it is hidden when the ribbon is scrolled 0 percent to the right.
The right scroll button passes 100 as the parameter, and it is hidden when the ribbon is scrolled 100 percent to the right.
Passing in `null` or parameters of unexpected types may cause this method to return <xref:System.Windows.DependencyProperty.UnsetValue>.
The values to be converted.
Four values are expected, one <xref href="System.Windows.Visibility"></xref> object that represents scroll bar visibility and three <xref:System.Double> values that represent the scroll bar position.
The type to be converted to.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Visibility"></xref> type is expected.
The desired percentage that the ribbon is scrolled to the right before the scroll button is hidden.
A <xref:System.Double> is expected.
The culture to use when converting.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Visibility"></xref> object representing the visibility of the scroll button.
This API is not implemented.
<xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.DoNothing?displayProperty=fullName> is returned to indicate that the binding should use the fallback or default value.
This API is not implemented.
This API is not implemented.
This API is not implemented.
This API is not implemented.
<xref href="System.Windows.Data.Binding.DoNothing"></xref> in all cases.
